alert.note: Alert for Hendricks (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 7:56PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Hendricks County through 830 PM EDT... At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Danville, or 22 miles west of Indianapolis, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Danville around 800 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Plainfield. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 62 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
